problem.markdown:
1. A bed constists of particles of density 2000 kg/m3. If the height of the bed is 1.5 m and its porosity 0.4, the pressure drop required to fluidize the bed is
(x) 14.86 k Pa () 25.61 kPa () 11.77 k Pa () 21.13 k Pa
2. Sphericity for a spherical particle is
() 0.5 () 0 (x) 1 () cannot say
3. A sphere settles freely through a pool of liquid and the settling is in stokes’ law range. The terminal velocity of the sphere will
() be independent of the liquid viscosity () increase linearly with viscosity (x) decrease inversely with viscosity () decrease inversely with the square of viscosity
4. Bed of particles can be fluidized with gases?
() false (x) True
5. Under fluidized condition?
() frictional force=force of gravity on the particles- Buoyancy force () frictional force (x) frictional force>force of gravity on the particles- Buoyancy force
problem.p: 1. A bed constists of particles of density 2000 kg/m3. If the height of the bed is 1.5 m and its porosity 0.4, the pressure drop required to fluidize the bed is
2. Sphericity for a spherical particle is
3. A sphere settles freely through a pool of liquid and the settling is in stokes’ law range. The terminal velocity of the sphere will

choicegroup.choice: be independent of the liquid viscosity
decrease inversely with the square of viscosity

problem.p: 4. Bed of particles can be fluidized with gases?

choicegroup.choice: frictional force=force of gravity on the particles- Buoyancy force
frictional force>force of gravity on the particles- Buoyancy force
